defined_class_definition: A fragment derived from a prepharyngeal amputation encompassing the head.
image_comment: A fragment derived from a prepharyngeal amputation encompassing the head.

defined_class_definition: A fragment derived from pre- and post-pharyngeal amputations, encompassing the pharynx and parapharyngeal region.
image_comment: Illustration of a trunk fragment (in green).

defined_class_definition: A fragment derived from a postpharyngeal amputation encompassing the tail.
image_comment: A fragment derived from a postpharyngeal amputation encompassing the tail.

defined_class_definition: A fragment derived from two prepharyngeal amputations, removing the head and posterior regions of the animal.
image_comment: Illustration of a prepharyngeal fragment (in green).

defined_class_definition: A fragment derived from two postpharyngeal amputations, removing the anterior region and the tail tip.
exact_syn: post-pharyngeal fragment | post-pharyngeal piece | postpharyngeal piece
image_comment: Illustration of a postpharyngeal fragment (in green).

defined_class_definition: A fragment encompassing all or part of the anterior region of the animal.
image_comment: A fragment encompassing all or part of the anterior region of the animal.

defined_class_definition: A fragment encompassing all or part of the posterior region of the animal.
image_comment: Illustration of an example of a posterior fragment (in green).

defined_class_definition: A fragment derived from an amputation parallel to or along any edge, which overlaps the lateral region, dorso-lateral region, ventro-lateral region, antero-lateral margin, lateral margin, ventro-lateral margin, postero-lateral margin, dorso-lateral margin, antero-lateral region, postero-lateral region. [SMR: a fragment that encompasses the side of the animal, not necessarily longituduinal, or parallel to the midline]
exact_syn: sagittal fragment | side fragment | longitudinal fragment | edge fragment
image_comment: A fragment derived from an amputation parallel to or along any edge, which overlaps the lateral region, dorso-lateral region, ventro-lateral region, antero-lateral margin, lateral margin, ventro-lateral margin, postero-lateral margin, dorso-lateral margin, antero-lateral region, postero-lateral region. [SMR: a fragment that encompasses the side of the animal, not necessarily longituduinal, or parallel to the midline]

defined_class_definition: a fragment derived from an amputation parallel to the midline.
image_comment: a fragment derived from an amputation parallel to the midline.

defined_class_definition: A 3D piece of tissue, usually though the whole depth of the animal encompassing both dorsal and ventral sides, often made with a biopsy punch.
image_comment: Illustration of an example plug fragment in green.

defined_class_definition: A piece of tissue removed from the lateral margin at any given point that extendes interiorly to more medial structures.
image_comment: Illustration of an example wedge fragment in green.
